name: ListZoomWebinarRegistrants
description:
Retrieve a list of registrants for a specified Zoom webinar.

Call this tool to obtain a list of all users who have registered for a specific Zoom webinar. This is useful for managing webinar attendees. Requires a Pro or higher plan with a Webinar add-on and appropriate OAuth scopes.

parameters.name: webinar_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the webinar for which registrants are being retrieved. This is required for the request.

parameters.name: webinar_occurrence_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a specific occurrence of the webinar. Use this ID to specify which instance of a recurring webinar you are querying.

value_schema.description: The meeting or webinar occurrence ID.

parameters.name: registrant_status
parameters.description: Filter registrants by status: 'pending' for those awaiting approval, 'approved' for accepted registrants, or 'denied' for rejected applications.

value_schema.description:
Query by the registrant's status. 
* `pending` - The registration is pending. 
* `approved` - The registrant is approved. 
* `denied` - The registration is denied.

parameters.name: registrants_tracking_source_id
parameters.description: The tracking source ID for webinar registrants, indicating the registration page location.

value_schema.description: The tracking source ID for the registrants. Useful if you share the webinar registration page in multiple locations. See [Creating source tracking links for webinar registration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000315683-Creating-source-tracking-links-for-webinar-registration) for details.

parameters.name: number_of_records_per_call
parameters.description: The number of registrant records to return within a single API call. This helps control the size of the response.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: deprecated_page_number
parameters.description: Deprecated. This field will be deprecated and is no longer supported in future releases. Use 'next_page_token' for pagination instead.

value_schema.description: **Deprecated** This field will be deprecated. We will no longer support this field in a future release. Instead, use the `next_page_token` for pagination.

parameters.name: pagination_next_page_token
parameters.description: Token for paginating through webinar registrant results when the available set exceeds the current page size. Expires in 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.
